meanings.sent1: The sulphurous fumes from the volcano made it unsafe to breathe.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the sulphurous properties of the mineral.
meanings.sent3: The sulphurous smell from the rotten eggs filled the room, causing everyone to gag.
meanings.sent4: The sulphurous taste of the medicine was enough to make anyone cringe.
meanings.sent5: The sulphurous yellow color of the chemical indicated its sulfur content.

meanings.definition: Having a strong, unpleasant smell like sulfur.
meanings.sent1: The kitchen was filled with a sulphurous odor after the burnt toast incident.
meanings.sent2: The sulphurous stench coming from the swamp was unbearable.
meanings.sent3: The sulphurous aroma of the skunk made the dog run away in fear.
meanings.sent4: The sulphurous cloud of gas enveloped the area, causing people to cover their noses.
meanings.sent5: The sulphurous scent of the rotten eggs lingered in the air for hours.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a fiery or hellish appearance.
meanings.sent1: The sulphurous flames of the bonfire lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The devil in the play had a sulphurous aura surrounding him.
meanings.sent3: The sulphurous glow of the lava made it look like a scene from a horror movie.
meanings.sent4: The sulphurous red color of the sunset painted the sky in a fiery hue.
meanings.sent5: The sulphurous heat of the desert made it feel like walking through hell.
